Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.server

Class ServerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.ServerManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class ServerManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class manages all communications on the server-side.

      Manages the enrollment of a incoming client, asking him if he wants to start a new game or if wants to reconnect to an ongoing match.

      Sends a message to all clients in lobby in order to check theirs presence.
      private void login​(int id)
      Manages the login asking for nickname and, if the client is the first of the lobby, the board on which play the match.

      Notifies all clients in lobby that the game is starting.

      Notifies all clients already logged in that a new client has connected.

      private void notifyTimeLeft​(int id, int size)
      Notifies a client how much time is left (if the minimum players number is already reached) or how many players miss (if the minimum players number is not yet reached).

      Removes a client regardless the communication technology used.

      Removes a client from the lobby, notifying others clients.

      Removes the match reference associated to a client and removes all the client's references.
      void run()
      Starts one server for each type of communication technology.
      java.lang.String sendMessageAndWaitForAnswer​(int number, Message message)
      Manages the delivery of a message and the wait of client's answer measuring time: if time exceeds before the answer's arrival, the client is marked as afk.

        public boolean isAwayFromKeyboardOrDisconnected​(int code)
        Checks if a client is marked as disconnected.
        Parameters:
        code - is the unique code of the client
        Returns:
        true if the client is disconnected

        void addClientToLog​(int temporaryId)
        Manages the enrollment of a incoming client, asking him if he wants to start a new game or if wants to reconnect to an ongoing match.

      • checkIfDisconnected

        private boolean checkIfDisconnected​(java.lang.String code)
        Checks if a client is effectively disconnected.
        Parameters:
        code - is the unique code of the client
        Returns:
        true if a client is disconnected even after having tried to communicate with him one last time

      • switchClientId

        private boolean switchClientId​(int oldId,
                               int temporaryId)
        Reassigns the old code to a client that is reconnecting to an ongoing match.
        Parameters:
        oldId - is the old code of the client
        temporaryId - is the new code of the client, assigned during reconnection
        Returns:
        true if reassignment successes

      • addClientToLobby

        private void addClientToLobby​(int id)
        Adds a client to the lobby after having concluded the enrollment.
        Parameters:
        id - is the code of the client

      • login

        private void login​(int id)
        Manages the login asking for nickname and, if the client is the first of the lobby, the board on which play the match.
        Parameters:
        id - is the code of the incoming client

      • notifyNewEntry

        private void notifyNewEntry​(int id,
                            java.lang.String newEntry)
        Notifies all clients already logged in that a new client has concluded the enrollment and keeps up-to-date them about the time left before the game start.
        Parameters:
        id - is the code of the last client logged in
        newEntry - is the name of the last client logged in

      • notifyNewConnection

        private void notifyNewConnection​(int id)
        Notifies all clients already logged in that a new client has connected.
        Parameters:
        id - is the code of the incoming client

      • notifyTimeLeft

        private void notifyTimeLeft​(int id,
                            int size)
        Notifies a client how much time is left (if the minimum players number is already reached) or how many players miss (if the minimum players number is not yet reached).
        Parameters:
        id - is the code of the addressee client
        size - is the current size of the lobby

      • lastCheckBeforeGameStarting

        private void lastCheckBeforeGameStarting()
        Sends a message to all clients in lobby in order to check theirs presence.

      • notifyGameStarting

        private void notifyGameStarting()
        Notifies all clients in lobby that the game is starting.

      • checkAllConnections

        public void checkAllConnections()
        Checks connection of all clients in lobby and if minimum players number is satisfied starts a new match.

      • createNewGame

        private void createNewGame()
        Starts a new match.

        Parameters:

      • removeClient

        private void removeClient​(int number)
        Removes a client regardless the communication technology used.
        Parameters:
        number - is the unique number of the client

      • removeClientFromLobby

        private void removeClientFromLobby​(int number)
        Removes a client from the lobby, notifying others clients. If the minimum number had been reached, it checks if that number is already satisfied, otherwise stops the countdown.
        Parameters:
        number - is the outgoing client

      • isListening

        public boolean isListening​(int user)
        Parameters:
        user - is the client
        Returns:
        true if the client is ready to receive message, false if it already have to reply to the last message

      • sendMessageAndWaitForAnswer

        public java.lang.String sendMessageAndWaitForAnswer​(int number,
                                                    Message message)
        Manages the delivery of a message and the wait of client's answer measuring time: if time exceeds before the answer's arrival, the client is marked as afk.
        Parameters:
        number - is the unique code of the addressee
        message - is the outgoing message
        Returns:
        the client's answer

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts one server for each type of communication technology.

        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
